review_text: Relaxing game with good music and achievements.  More than half my time played was spent trying to find the last cat (#54).

[h3]When I bought it, I never imagined it would be a legitimate way to unlock 100 achievements. [/h3] Once I realized that, I didn't want to keep going. I felt like I'd be cheating myself‚Äîlike those achievements wouldn't represent real effort anymore.
[i]What will others think when they see I played this? They won't know how hard I worked for the tough ones in my favorite games.  [/i]
That‚Äôs when it hit me: [b]achievements don‚Äôt matter that much.[/b] With games like this‚Äîand tools like SAM‚Äîhaving thousands of them only means something to the person who earned them, and knows how.
Letting go of their value frees me to just enjoy the game. No pressure. No checklist.
[i]And if I want to replay something?[/i] I‚Äôll just do it. Whether I‚Äôm at 100% or not, or whether I go back just because I liked it. [b]That‚Äôs what I learned thanks to this game. [/b]
[spoiler]Although honestly? It sucks. It was nice looking for kittens though. [/spoiler]

I love these style of games but some are great and others not so much. Thankfully this series of games is the former, its simple yet effective, and the art style is great as well. If you like finding cats then this game is for you, more so if you have an affinity with Christmassyness.

[h1]Meow:3[/h1]

Wow, I've played many similar games, but never found one cuter than this.

[b]Here we have:[/b][list]
[*]A hundred cats.
[*]Night mode.
[*]New Year's atmosphere.
[*]Tons of interactive elements - summon Santa, listen to Christmas carols and even watch fireworks!
[*]Plus there's a second level, so that's 200 cats in total!!!
[/list]
And since this game is completely free, I wish every Steam user will try it! A very kind and cute game.

[code]If you read the review and liked it, don't forget to give it a thumbsup;)[h3][i]The further - The better‚ô•Ô∏è[/i][/h3][/code]

[h3] Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam - A Positive Review [/h3]

[h3] What To Expect? [/h3]
It's a hidden object game in which you'll have to find a hundred hidden cats in a festive themed level. There's also an extra level in which you can find a hundred more cats. Expect a few minutes of gameplay.

[h3] Visuals, Audio and Performance [/h3]
It's a simple hand-drawn Hidden Object game with festive attributes. For audio, it has cheerful music playing. For performance, it should run on any computer and I didn't run into bugs.

[h3] My Recommendations [/h3]
If you're into hidden object games then this may be for you, I would recommend it to everyone. Also, check out the other games from this developer!

Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam Is A Really Nice And Short Game. Just like the title says, there are 100 cats, and all you have to do is find them! Just like in the pictures on the store page, there is a Christmas scenery where you have to find those cats. All you have to do is click on the cat, and then you have officially found 1 cat of the 100. The cats turn blue when you find them, so you know which cats you have already found. The art for this game looks really good, and the cats really blend into the Christmas background. Overall, this is a really nice and short game to play for a few minutes.
Preatty stress free game, not bad, for a good distracion. recomended

Put on your Jingle Jammies (tm) and prepare to find the cats hidden in the jingle jam. The orange cats hidden in the orange marmalade is a particularly tough section, and the black cats hidden in the blackberry jam gave me a run for my money. 14 sweet, fruity, festive minutes well spent.

Of course, this game has nothing to do with jams, jellies, or marmalades, I'm just a dork.
It is, however, worth playing if you're looking for a bit of xmas-themed cat-finding fun.

Sorry if I got you hangry for some toast and jam (not sorry).
Great game to just calm down. I had a lot of stress just now and then remebered I had this in my library. Absoluty amazing on bringing me back to earth. I love that every cat has its own name

Forced ad at launch was not a great first impression (puts you in the Steam overlay).

The game (such as it is) took 6 minutes, one pass. Absolute torrent of achievements, the pop-ups for which annoying cover the bottom right corner and the cats that live there.

And at the 100th cat, the game crashed to desktop. If there was supposed to be some payoff, I didn't get to see it.

Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam is a point and click hidden object game where you find cats in a snowy Christmas town. I enjoy a game with a theme and I think to enjoy this game the most it would be best be played during the holiday season, feels festive, you know? I would recommend Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam if you enjoy cats and hidden object games. Give it a try! Find those holly jolly cats!

I just wanted to adjust the volume, so I pressed ESC to open the settings.
Instead, the game returned me to the title screen without saving, and all my progress was wiped. I had to start over from scratch.

Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam, is a rather short but pleasant and relaxing experience, it's as simple as the name suggests, find all the cat's hidden before you.
It's a great game to fill the void or simply allow yourself to just shut off for a while.

Overall it's a solid game that delivers exactly what it sets out to achieve and it's 100% worth the time it take's to complete!

Great game, best afternoon I've spent. Also a surprisingly effective demonstration of why screen protectors exist. My partner‚Äôs ‚ÄòIT‚ÄôS RIGHT THERE‚Äô finger event is now a tiny dent on my screen.

I also highly, [i]highly[/i] commend the achievements. For once, someone actually made them nice. They don‚Äôt ask for nonsense like ‚ÄòFind 50,000 cats over 500 games.‚Äô Instead, they quietly track your progress and even give you clever hints about what your missing cat looks like.

Finally, I went to sleep having dreams that sounded like:
doo doo,
doodoo doo,
doodoo doo,
doodoo doo doo doo,
doodoo doo,
doodoo doo,
doo-doo0 doodooo do Dooo0...
Meh. It's free and pretty entertaining fin the 5-10min it takes to find the cats. But that's it.

Cats and puzzle

A free and great hidden object game where you have to find 100 cats in the scenery. It‚Äôs short but very enjoyable, with great art and music as well. There are also additional secrets to find. An update added an entire, harder level with 100 more cats to discover, although there are no achievements tied to that one.
Given that it‚Äôs short, free, and fun, there‚Äôs no reason not to play it. And if you want more, there are several similar games available on Steam.

My 6-year-old son and I love playing Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam together!

It‚Äôs such a simple, fun game that‚Äôs perfect for kids and parents to enjoy side by side. The art and cute cats make it really engaging, and it‚Äôs a great way to spend some quality time without anything too complicated.

We always have a blast trying to find all the hidden cats, and it‚Äôs become one of our favorite little family games. Highly recommend if you want something lighthearted and kid-friendly to play together.

The first map has 100 achievements - one for each cat you find).
The second map also has 100 cats to discover, though it doesn‚Äôt come with Steam achievements at all. The second map feels a bit more challenging, which keeps things interesting.

I'm quite happy that this game is free; there are 2 levels: the first is quite satisfying, while the second is somewhat disappointing due to the way some cats are drawn.
Overall, neither level has nice art... I find them fairly ugly to be honest, and the human imitations of cats meowing is almost insulting to my ears.
But, because it's free, I've given it a thumbs up.

After completing and thoroughly enjoying Cats Hidden Around the World, I decided to go back and try out the earlier chapters of the series, which focus on individual cities or specific countries.

Overall, while these games offer much shorter experiences ‚Äî each chapter usually consisting of just one or two maps ‚Äî I found it particularly enjoyable how interactive the environments were.
In these episodes, it‚Äôs fun to click on various background elements and see them react with sounds, animations, or color changes ‚Äî a charming detail that seemed less present in the latest chapter.

In terms of difficulty, the earlier games are noticeably easier: a more relaxed and laid-back experience, more in line with what I initially expected from Around the World. Perfect for players looking for a light, casual experience without much pressure.

However, the soundtrack remains an issue I had already noticed: the music tends to feel repetitive, and since it accompanies you throughout the entire gameplay, a bit more variety would have helped make the atmosphere feel fresher and more engaging.

One thing I particularly enjoyed ‚Äî though it might not be for everyone ‚Äî is the massive number of achievements you unlock simply by finding each little cat.
Personally, I found it quite satisfying, but I can see how some players might feel that it disrupts the game's relaxing flow.

Cats hidden in Jingle Jam: I really enjoyed stumbling upon animated objects and colorful interactions just by playing around with the environment. The first map was way too easy ‚Äî I finished it in about two minutes (and I probably could‚Äôve done it even faster if I‚Äôd been focused).

The second map, on the other hand, was much more challenging. Even though it was small, I had to use some hints because I just couldn‚Äôt find a few of the cats. Honestly, if you could spot those right away, you might want to get your head checked ‚Äî they were that well hidden.

Overall, considering it‚Äôs free, it‚Äôs a light and fun experience, probably aimed at newcomers to the Cats Hidden series. It doesn‚Äôt have the depth of the other entries, but as a quick intro or short casual game, it does the job.

In conclusion, I wouldn‚Äôt discourage anyone from trying out these earlier chapters: they still offer a pleasant experience, especially for those looking for something quick and easy.
That said, unlike Around the World, don‚Äôt expect to spend much more than 30 minutes playing ‚Äî you might end up finishing the game before you even realize it.

I played this game with my little sister. It is a very cute and charming game! If you are looking for a simple but wholesome and cute game, I totally recommend it. The game is free but I can definitely see myself paying for the other games in these series because they are only a dollar.

"Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam" is yet another "Where's Waldo" "I can't believe this isn't a webpage" "game" up on Steam... and yeah, the first time you see one of these you think it's nice, but there's literally hundreds of these low effort, 5 minute "games" plagueing Steam... and when there's hundreds and hundreds of something that's pretty much valueless, that's spam/pollution.  It's not good for gamers.

What do you do in the game?  Click on hidden cats.

The game features really lacklustre 2D visuals (does the developer not know 3D graphics became mainstream in the mid-1990s?).  Gamers don't spend thousands of dollars on gaming rigs and the latest 3D graphics cards to play 2D games.  Even mobile phones and game consoles can do 3D graphics now.  There's no excuse.

This is only free in a rudimentary sense... the developer has their hand out for a $5 USD "donation" for this as you were expected to buy the soundtrack from Steam... digital panhandling.  Like the homeless guys who splash dirty water on your windscreen at the traffic lights.  No thanks.

Bearing in mind that free games don't add +1 to your game collector count, should you bother adding this to your library and downloading it?

Not this time.  This isn't worth downloading.  While this won't cost you any money, you get what you pay for, and sometimes, even when the game is free, it's still not enough.
Brought me great joy, finding cats is very fulfilling work

I have to say, Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam is one of the best games I have ever played. It's not just a game, it's a life-changing experience. It's a game that brought joy, peace, and love back into my marriage.

My wife and I have been married for 10 years, but we were going through a rough patch. We had grown apart, we barely talked, we argued a lot, and we had lost the spark that we once had. We were on the verge of divorce, and we didn't know how to fix it.

Then, one day, I stumbled upon this game on Steam. It was free, it looked cute, and it was made for a charity event. I thought, why not give it a try? Maybe it would cheer me up a bit. I downloaded it and started playing.

I was immediately hooked. The game was so relaxing, so charming, so fun. I loved finding and discovering the 100 cats hidden around the festive holiday village. I loved the hand-drawn artwork, the chill soundtrack, the easter eggs, and the achievements. I felt like a kid again, exploring a magical world full of wonder and surprises.

But the best part was, I wasn't alone. My wife noticed me playing the game, and she was curious. She asked me what it was, and I told her. She decided to join me, and we started playing together. We took turns finding the cats, we helped each other with the hints, we laughed at the funny animations, we competed for the timer mode, and we celebrated every achievement.

We had so much fun, we forgot about our problems. We rediscovered our common interests, our sense of humor, our teamwork, and our affection. We started talking again, listening again, understanding again, and loving again. We realized that we still had a lot in common, and that we still cared for each other.

We played the game every day, until we found all the cats and unlocked all the achievements. We even bought the DLC and the other games from the Travellin Cats franchise. We became fans of the developer and the artist, and we followed them on social media. We also donated to the Jingle Jam charity event, and we felt good about supporting a great cause.

But most importantly, we saved our marriage. We decided to give it another chance, and to work on our issues. We went to counseling, we communicated better, we compromised more, and we appreciated more. We rekindled the flame that we once had, and we fell in love all over again.

All thanks to this game. Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam is not just a game, it's a miracle. It's a game that saved my marriage, and my happiness. It's a game that I will always cherish, and always recommend. It's a game that everyone should play, especially with their loved ones.

If you haven't played it yet, do yourself a favor and play it now. You won't regret it. Trust me, it will change your life for the better. It did for me, and it can for you too.

Thank you, Travellin Cats, for making this game. Thank you, Nina-Serena, for creating this art. Thank you, The Yogscast, for hosting this event. Thank you, Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam, for saving my marriage.

What an adorable Christmas game from Travellin Cats. Just in time to get you into the Christmas spirit right when December hits. The cats are cute as always and you cannot beat the price. I wish their was dlc for this game, that is my only real gripe. I love these games and more is always better :) 

Also the ending once you find all the cats is just a great little bonus. Very festive! And if you can please support The Yogscast Jingle Jam for charity! üéÑ

I love the little extra things in this game.  It's not all just clicking on hidden cats.  There's snowmen that do something if you click on them, other objects that otherwise would just blend into the background are interactive.  It's fun to find all those.

The main objective is to find cats.  You are presented with a large hand-drawn Christmas themed screen.  Zoom in or you'll never find some of the cats because size varies.  Each time you click on a cat it meows.  And there are different meows, not just one.  Also a name pops up as an achievement.  

Music is the same as in all their games.  I really wish they would at least vary the tone a little because it's getting old after having  many of their games.

Cats hidden in Jingle Jam

This game is a hidden object game. Or rather, a hidden cat game!

You search for 100 cats in a hand drawn black and white illustration.
The game is very simple and it will only cost you like 5 minutes of your time.
It's great to play with your kids and introduce them to videogames.

The cats meow when you find them. And there are some pretty funny meows in there!

But also great for achievement hunters!
Each cat you find is an achievement. There's no easier way to get those stats up!

I love playing these type of games with my son and therefor I'll rate the game with a 6/10
It's not bad at all just very short.

Short, Simple, Find the ' Cats ' puzzle.
Other Interactive objects hidden around the town.

A breeze to sweep through, 
the challenge only begins within half a dozen, 
get stunned and blinded by the ' Black n White ', looking for the missing One(s).

Achievements are listed as ' Private ' for now.

Played and Forgotten.
Free, what else to say.

Another cute visual find the cat puzzle game.

Finally did it without any hints.

Thanks to the dev for letting people enjoy for free along with the paid titles as well.
It took 3 minutes to finish this one, it's pleasant and very easy!
Simple and easy search game that is accompanied by pleasant music.
This game is not for the feint of heart. The mechanics are deep, and the amazing graphics are so good I feel that I'm seeing the real world. 10/10 would play again!!!!

So many Cats that my Allergy kicked in.
But i played further, cause of insane Graphics which can reach more than 3500 FPS with disabled VSync.
With that much FPS you can better Aim then your CS-Bot.
An enjoyable time waster. Hidden puzzle game where you only look for cats in a winter holiday scene.

Nice game :) And absolutely free!) Thanks to the developer!)
Funny cat sounds {as always, same to other game of this studio I played}. Gentle music {same to other game, but with Christmas bell sounds} )
It is always interesting to find all cats without using hints)  
Cute little easter_eggs. Though during the moment with [spoiler]Santa[/spoiler] my FPS decreases ~by 2 times {I've got quite weak graphics card}. 
Easy achievements {each cat found = 1 achievement}. 
Sweet and relaxing game {for half an hour} for the upcoming winter holidays)
Simple and fun. Nice touch to have some basic settings (light intensity, music sliders etc). Worth playing

Got this game for free: As an artist, I love the art style of this game and the soundtrack is nice as it doesn't feel extremely repetitive. Took me 18 minutes total to complete both the first run and then the timed run together. If I had to provide any negative feedback its that there should be a mute button for the ticking in the timed run and the achievements are too much. I would much rather it have achievements for completion, finding all the ester eggs, and for beating it in under a certain time rather than one for every cat you find. Overall, great way to kill some time.

[b]EST Completion Time (1 Playthrough):[/b] 5-15 minutes
[b]Achievements Available:[/b] 100
[b]EST Completion Time (100% Achievements):[/b] 5-15 minutes
[b]Trading Cards Available:[/b] 0 (N/A)

[h1]Overview[/h1]
Created in collaboration with Yogscast for their Jingle Jam charity event, [i]Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam[/i] is a delightful, hand-drawn hidden object game in which your goal is to find 100 cats in a festive holiday village. Although the game only includes 1 level, it is so unexpectedly charming with its cute, hand-drawn graphics, cheerful music, and surprises/secrets that even Scrooge or The Grinch would be unable to resist its charm and would find themselves enamored with it.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
‚Ä¢ Cute, hand-drawn graphics accompanied by wonderfully festive & whimsical music.
‚Ä¢ Each cat meows in its own unique voice/sound when clicked/found; some of which are quite comical.
‚Ä¢ Clicking on certain ‚Äúnon-cat‚Äù objects produces (unexpected but welcomed) sound effects (i.e., [spoiler]clinking the mug in the center of the map, or clicking the bells on the market stalls to make them jingle[/spoiler]) or animations (i.e., [spoiler]briefly animated snowmen[/spoiler]).
‚Ä¢ Counter at the bottom of the screen indicates how many hidden cats remain.
‚Ä¢ Hints available (if needed) when only 6 hidden cats remain.

[h1]Cons[/h1]
‚Ä¢ Leaderboard (for optional timed rounds) is personal; no global or ‚Äúfriends only‚Äù leaderboards.

[h1]Guide to 100% Purrrfection:[/h1]
Check out my achievement guide for 100% [i]purrrfection[/i]!
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3101886948

[h1]TL;DR:[/h1]
Aside from it being free-to-play, [i]Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam[/i] is a [u]must play[/u] for anyone who loves hidden object games, Christmas, and/or cats.

[i]Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam[/i] is a free-to-play, hidden object game by indie developer Travellin Cats, the developer(s) of [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/2313250/Cats_Hidden_in_Paris/][i]Cats Hidden in Paris[/i][/url]. The objective of the game is to find one hundred cats hidden in each of two lovingly hand-drawn images. The game is very short, taking only thirty to forty minutes to complete, after which the time trial feature is unlocked for future playthroughs. While the time trial feature adds some replayability, the position of the cats do not change in future playthroughs which turns the game into a memory game.

Compared to [i]Cats Hidden in Paris[/i], [i]Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam[/i] has a variety of improvements to the graphic and sound design. There are a number of hidden, interactive elements across the two levels/maps that add to the charming atmosphere with cute animations and colours. Though there is only one soundtrack, it is pleasant to listen to and, more importantly, it now plays during the game, not just the menu! Each cat in the level/map produces a unique (as far as I can tell) '[i]meow[/i]' sound when clicked on and has an associated achievement which shows its name and number.

Unrelated to this review, the developer(s) requested feedback on the closing screen which I will provide as follows: Firstly, I think players should have a choice between listening to the music or to the ticking timer during the time trial mode. Secondly, I think it would be nice to give players the choice of having a timer during the first playthrough as well as some players may enjoy such a challenge. Finally, thanks for making this game free!

I really like game. The way the picture is created looks simply but I see it is intention and it has cartoon style look. It reminds me story art books for children from my country. It is just funny. The difficulty of the game is well balanced. The control system is good and responsive and I like the zoom system and the help. I really appreciate 'Easter eggs', the animated gifts or jokes connected with lamps, gifts, snowman. I recommend to connect it with achievements.

Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam is a 100 Cats hidden object game.  Beat it in 5 minutes using a mouse, then again in another 5 minutes timed for kicks.  Good game for kids. 

Finding the cats is fun, and there's so much extra stuff in the art to click on that makes this one extra wholesome.  Great for the holiday season.  

There are 100 achievements, one for each cat.  

It's freeee.......
Quick and easy game that will only take 5-10 minutes to complete. I got tired of other games and tried this one, and I was not disappointed. GG to the developers.

This developer has come a long way in refining his drawings, so CONGRATULATIONS! Those dreadful thick lines were absent. And even though the cats weren't so cleverly hidden, it was much more pleasant looking for them.  And there were no 'how could you possibly know this' things involved.  Congratulations!

Simple, free, cute cats

Includes themed eastereggs for nice surprises

Game look simple but image is perfect.
Sound and "secret" sounds are perfect. I really like it.

I remember that I was buying that kind of games before and I was surprised when I saw that this game is free.

Easy achievements.

Cozy christmas vibes and a fun, short game of finding hidden cats. They added a second level in 2024. And it's free!

A wonderfully cozy time commemorating one of the best times of the year. I love all the effort that went into these levels, and it's hard to beat the price point. Give it a spin, and remember to support the Jingle Jam!

Relaxing and funny game where you just need to find 100 hidden cats. Once you find them all, you just completed the whole game. Sounds easy right? In case you are still missing some cats, just take a look at my guide. :)

Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam" is a game that combines the thrill of searching for hidden objects with the festive charm of the Christmas season. The premise is simple: find all the cats hidden in festive scenes full of charming details. From adorable costumed kittens to decorations sparkling Christmas decorations, the game offers a visually appealing experience that is sure to delight feline and Christmas lovers.

However, despite its initial charm, the game has some limitations that may affect the player's experience in the long run. The lack of variety in the scenes and the absence of additional challenges beyond finding cats can make the gameplay become monotonous after a while. Additionally, the lack of customization options or alternative game modes could limit its appeal to those looking for a more diverse and lengthy experience.

In short, "Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam" is a fun and endearing proposal to enjoy during the Christmas season, especially for lovers of cats and the search for hidden objects. However, its lack of depth and variety may leave some players wanting more after a while.
6/10

love me some cats. love me a free game. love finding things. love achievement noise. love feeling accomplished. good game.

(i love how the cats are hidden into the architecture and buildings)

Honestly one of the best find the cats games imo. the art style is very nice and doesnt hurt my eyes like others do. also there is a fun amount of other non cats to interact with, and i like the fireworks at the end of the game. sometimes things look like cats but arent and thats fun. very good game

- this is lidolay the best game ive ever played ever

What an amazing game! This might be the best simple hidden game ever.

It was delightful to play. I was smiling the whole time! The art was super cute and consistent, but not bland at all. And each cat actually looked like a cat, it wasn't just a part of a cat's body.

I loved that each cat had a name, and each had a different meow! How much work must that have been!

Has a nice feature of zooming, which allowed me to find the last couple of cats.

The music was very charming.

At the end I loved the little celebration with lights and fireworks! The only thing even better was to have a fully coloured picture, but that is reaaally too much work haha.

What an amazing game, and it's free! Play it!

This game is delightful. I smiled at each cat's meow; some of them made me laugh out loud. The extra stuff that you "unlock" by clicking certain things is fun and cute. Oh, and I enjoy getting 100 easy achievements, too!
Great game ... took me 15 mins to find all cats ... the black and white does a number on your eyes to make you not see the cats lol ...

"Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam" is a hidden object game in which you have to find all the cats hidden around a festive holiday village. This game has a hint/reset button, a festive soundtrack with different sound effects, a save feature, hidden secrets in the environment, animation elements, 100 achievements, and 100 cats.
It's a very short game as it took me only 3 minutes to finish it and get all the achievements (all the achievements can be acquired in one sitting). It has only one ending and there is a save feature, so you can restart or continue the game from the moment you left off. I would rate its difficulty as 1/10 since the gameplay is minimal, there's a hint button available for unlimited use, and the instructions remain clear throughout the entire game (you need to find and right-click on each cat).
Travellin Cats, in collaboration with The Yogscast, presents "Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam" - a free Christmas-themed hidden object game that includes all necessary controls (turning music/sounds on/off, zoom in/out, a hint button, and a reset button), along with some hidden surprises. The goal of the game is to click on every single cat hidden in the picture and this may sound easy, but in game it can be very challenging due to the cats having different kind of shapes and dimensions. The control system is good, and the game's difficulty is well-balanced. After finding all the hidden cats, you will also unlock the "Timer Mode" with a leaderboard where you can set and beat your own score (my personal best is 02:13:65). 
All things considered, I would definitely recommend this game to casual players of all ages who want to test their observation skills or who like hidden object games with cats. üò∫
If you can't find the last cat then you can watch my full game playthrough here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8WtkcDuwf0g&ab_channel=Spartakus
P.S. If you like this kind of games then I would also recommend you the "I commissioned some bees/dogs/cats" series. Check it out on Steam.
P.P.S. Don't forget to support The Yogscast and their Jingle Jam charity event!
https://jinglejam.tiltify.com/
Happy Holidays, everybody! üå≤

Very entertaining! Now I feel the need to buy a cat (warning: can be very addictive). Can't wait to see a Hard mode or a Hell mode. To get a little more serious: a timed 2-player mode where one player can hide objects and the other has to find them.

Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam is a delightful hidden object game in which you have to find 100 cats hidden in a hand-drawn black and white winter village. Each cat you find makes a little meowing sound. There are also a number of other objects in the scene that you can interact with. The cats blend in very well into the artwork and a few of them are really tricky to find. The game features a helpful hint system as well.

Great game! Truly amazing, many thanks to the chef. Really knows how to cook these furballs, only needed to find the ingredients to the meal. I recommend, I really do! Especially with sweet and chili sauce.

Please support the Yogscast Jingle Jam for charity! Also, its weird for me in that all the cat names are those of Yogscast members and I know more than half of the names. 

Anywho, easy achievements, free to play, Yogscast themed and made in support of a charity drive. What's not to like?

INCREDIBLE immersion. The story had me at the edge of my seat for HOURS. Finishing the game and seeing the jolly whereabouts of the lost kittens of Jingle Jam warmed my heart and gave me a reason to live.

Decided to look at the game on a whim, and it was fun and free, so there was no reason not to play. For anyone concerned about the brightness of a white screen, there is an option to turn the brightness down. No dark mode for inverted colours though.

some people rave and wonder of the likes of games like Elden Ring, RE4, Skyrim etc. but such people have not played Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam. This game after each discover leaves you wondering scavenging for more information. To arise to completion of this game is difficult and satisfying but the best more indulging gaming experience I've ever had.
I really like this game, but if only there was a way to find more cats in another part of the world, perhaps in Paris?
Lots of little secrets. Kid has played it multiple times learning how to use a mouse. Timer mode if you want to get serious.

Now, with that caveat out of the way: it's free, the art is decent, you get a nice little celebratory fireworks show at the end.  I would say it's 100% worth playing.

Super cute game to play during the winter season! 

A wonderful Christmas village we get to careful peek through to find 100 hidden kitties!
The art is fantastic, the music is great and the interaction inside the puzzle and the finale celebration are just so awesome!

The entire 'Cats Hidden In' series is really good and I would recommend you to get them all!

First Impression: A cute Christmas game where you have to find 100 cats.

Gameplay: Simple and smooth gameplay using either a Xbox controller or wireless mouse. I also enjoyed the lovely animation of the fireworks going off and the little Christmas lights. 

TL;DR Review: A cute and fun cat game to play during the Christmas season.

Would I recommend this?: Yes.

Computer Specs: ASUS ROG Zephyrus G15 Gaming Laptop 15.6" 24GB RAM 1TB SSD

Another fun little game, find all the cats.
Wel drawn, funny names for the cats and just a enjoyable game to pass some time.
its great when i can hear the sound of the cat each time i found them , and the option of lower the brightness is really great since most of game time will be all white

Really cute game! Love how they meow as you click them, and that there are hidden little easter eggs and tidbits as you go along. The only downside I can think of is how there's an achievement for EVERY SINGLE CAT you click, that is 100 achievements I got spammed with during gameplay. Maybe just change it down to every 10 you find or specific ones that are harder to find? Otherwise, really nice. 9/10

This is just a short free hidden image game (about 5 mins?). It was fine enough with drawing style similar to Hidden Through Time series.

I appreciated the sound settings and even brightness setting in the game. However, the incessant achievement pinging from Steam was painful and in order to finish it I had to mute the sound on my computer in order to continue without that. So, be just be aware of that going into it.

Bless the devs for making it free

Just a cozy game of cats and jingle
I loved the ending and the extra interactions

Adorable meows with every click, brain happi :D
Simple and straight forward point-and-click hidden object game! Very pleasant art style and music, as well as a very helpful zoom option. :) Lovely time lovely game
My mind was restored for 10min by kittens. It feels good to see achievements keep popping up ;3

This is a lovely puzzle game and for the upcoming holidays its even better! I love how the fireworks go off and the little christmas lights around the entire puzzle are animated. The art is very pretty.
Another win from Travellin Cats. Love this series, and greatly appreciate the freebie! If you're looking for a quick chill way to spend a few minutes, pick up some Travellin Cats.

Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam is a hand drawn hidden object game. The game has a nice look and easter eggs to put a smile on your face. 100 cats are hidden on a small map. Find and click on all 100 of them to beat the game. 

The game is fun but very very short. It would take 5-10 minutes to find all the cats. Once you have completed the game once you unlock timed mode, but since you already know the locations of the cats it ain't much.

The game is free and fun for a short bit. Find some cats and enjoy the victory screen. (also try to find al the present)

Ever since i was born, my family has had cats, there wasn't a moment that we didn't have a cat.
I remember each cat, i love them all, and i miss the late ones.
Now i have 3 cats, and this game brings even more purrfect joy for me.
The only thing that could make this game better, was if there were more cats in it, like a thousand atleast, and even more.
Ps i love cats<3

Cats Hidden in Jingle Jam forces us to confront the age old question "Where's the damn Cat?" but cranks the difficulty up to 11. Typically, the cat will simply be behind or under the bed. Here we have 100 different cats all trained in espionage hiding in the great city of Jingle Jam, and they won't settle for lazy hiding spots. Honestly, the mayor of Jingle Jam should do something about this. It's not my problem though. I don't live in Jingle Jam and I will not be visiting this winter. Happy Holidays everybody.
